champ.champInfo:
The overall management of the competition is carried out by the department of education, youth and sports, children's affairs and culture of the Chinadiyiv settlement council and the Zakarpattia regional Kyokushin-kan karate-do federation. The direct holding of the competition is entrusted to the Zakarpattia Regional Federation of Kyokushinkan Karate-do, the organizing committee and the main panel of judges
The main observer of the event is the branch chief of Ukraine, head of the judges' panel of the WFKK, judge of the international category shihan Chungin M.P. (5th dan, Brody)
The chief judge of the event is the judge of the national category Yu. M. Rusyn (1st dan, Mukachevo)
Chief secretary of the event - Yu. Yu. Rusyn (Mukachevo)

Teams of sports schools of Zakarpattia region, individual clubs of regional and city federations and other eastern martial arts participate in the competition.

The competition is held on November 19, 2023


Competition program on November 18, 2023.

  • 09:00-14:00 - arrival of participating teams
  • 14:00-16:00 - mandate and medical commission, weighing, registration of participants, judges and team representatives
  • 16:00-19:00 - judges' seminar, judges' seminar, formation of judges' teams

Competition program on November 19, 2023.

  • 08:00 - 09:00: registration of participants
  • 09:15 â€“ 10:00: meeting of the judging teams
  • 10:00 - 10:30: opening of the competition
  • 10:30 - 16:30: matches
  • 16:30 - 18:00: end of competition, awarding of prize winners

Boys categories:

  • U7: -20.0 -25.0 -30.0 30.0+
  • U9: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
  • U11: -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 45.0+
  • U13: -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 50.0+
  • U15: -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 65.0+
  • U17: -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 -70.0 70.0+

Categories girls:

  • U7: -20.0 -25.0 -30.0 30.0+
  • U9: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
  • U11: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 40.0+
  • U13: -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 50.0+
  • U15: -50.0 -55.0 55.0+
  • U17: -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 60.0+

In case of insufficient number of competition participants, presence of different level and qualifications of athletes in a weight category or other reasons, for the purpose of high-quality and safe conduct of the competition, the organizers of the competition have the right to make the following changes:

  • combine some weight and age categories
  • introduce new weight and age categories
  • hold competitions in appropriate weight categories according to the round robin system
  • If the athlete does not appear on the tatami after the announcement of his name within 1 minute, the athlete is considered defeated

Match time

"Kumite" competition section.In this section of the competition, all participants, regardless of qualification level, perform together.

  • U7: qualifying matches - 1.0 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.0 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 1.5 kg)
  • U9: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U11: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U13: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 3 kg)
  • U15 (boys): qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 3 kg)
  • U17 (boys): qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 3 kg)
  • U15 (girls): qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U17 (girls): qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)

Rewarding

The winners and prize-winners of the competitions are awarded with cups, medals and diplomas of the respective degrees.
